h1_title: The Beguiling Chant of the Pagoda Realm
img_above_text:
# The Beguiling Chant of the Pagoda Realm
## Snow-Veiled Trail
The next area is a bit deceptive in its multiple paths when in reality the rest of the Pagoda Realm is fairly linear (and even quick) should you be interested in progressing as soon as possible.
The main path leads up a slope to the left of the Shrine, and then to a large rock-filled forested area further left that you can ignore if you keep on the main path up to the Warding Temple where the last boss of this area is.
However, you can first explore a second short area off to the right from the Shrine leading downhill.

Head through the rest of the valley and deal with a Yaksha Patroller, which will lead to another rope bridge leading to a higher ledge.

img_summary: The image depicts a snowy area within the "Snow-Veiled Trail" section of the Pagoda Realm. A combat encounter is underway, featuring a Yaksha Patroller near an ornate, pagoda-like structure partially embedded in a rocky cliff. The foreground shows a character on the ground, possibly recovering or preparing to engage, while the enemy stands near a treasure chest. This scene aligns with the preceding text, which describes navigating through a valley and encountering a Yaksha Patroller before progressing further along the trail. The image visually represents a key moment of exploration and combat in this area.
